topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac2e356368727bfe0003e7#post_55ac2e356368727bfe0003e7

If he's the latter then the expenses are covered in part by the gym he belongs to. He doesn't get paid for the fights, but the gym absorbs parts of the expenses (equipment, bandages, etc.).

Once he gets on the pro circuit then he'll start getting paid depending on the length of the matches and weight category (You don't pay the same to a heavyweight and a featherweight). Most begin with 4-5 rounds and get paid based on the points they score on each one, plus a bonus for the victory.


At least that's how it works here, it probably is different in Japann.
